title: Arches National Park: Park Home
body: A red rock wonderland  Visit Arches and discover a landscape of contrasting colors, landforms and textures unlike any other in the world. The park has over 2,000 natural stone arches, in addition to hundreds of soaring pinnacles, massive fins and giant balanced rocks. This red rock wonderland will amaze you with its formations, refresh you with its trails, and inspire you with its sunsets.                Got Water?   Hydration is essential in the desert, even in winter. Drink 1 gallon (4 L) of water per day. Refill at the visitor center or Devils Garden.        Road Construction   Major construction projects may cause delays and closures, including the closure of Devils Garden Campground Mar 1 - Oct 31, 2017.              Traffic and Webcams   Arches is currently experiencing heavy visitation. You can check traffic webcams, and read more about traffic conditions in the park.        Ranger Programs   Join a ranger to explore the wonders of Arches National Park.        Looking to Camp?   Devils Garden Campground requires advanced reservations March-October, but there are lots of other options in the Moab area.              Bookstore   The Canyonlands Natural History Association operates a bookstore at Arches Visitor Center.        Art in the Park   The Community Artist in the Parks program connects local artists and visitors to the surrounding red rock environment.        Flowers of Arches   What was that flower you saw at Arches? Check our online flower guide to find out!              Connect with Us!   Join our online community by following ArchesNPS on your favorite social media platform.        Centennial Events   Check a listing of centennial events at all southeast Utah parks - Arches, Canyonlands, Hovenweep, and Natural Bridges.        Regulations   It is your responsibility to know park regulations when you visit.
